block.p: Dr. Patricia Ann Aikens, a chemist, was married yesterday to Dr. Michael Howland Roberts, a biologist. The Rev. James M. Taylor performed the ceremony at Grace Epiphany Episcopal Church in Philadelphia.

Dr. Patricia Ann Aikens, a chemist, was married yesterday to Dr. Michael Howland Roberts, a biologist. The Rev. James M. Taylor performed the ceremony at Grace Epiphany Episcopal Church in Philadelphia.

Dr. Aikens, 40, is the director of new technologies in Totowa, N.J., for Dragoco, a fragrance and flavor manufacturer. She graduated from Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute and received a Ph.D. in organic chemistry from Emory University. She is a daughter of Kathleen Aikens and Dr. David Aikens of Troy, N.Y. Her father retired as the chairman of the chemistry department at Rensselaer, which is in Troy. Her mother retired as a nurse at the day treatment center of the Rensselaer County Association for Retarded Citizens in Troy.

Dr. Roberts, 44, is the chairman of the biology department at Pace University in Pleasantville, N.Y. He graduated from Union College in Schenectady, N.Y., and received a master's degree and a Ph.D. in biology from the University of Virginia. He is a son of Zara B. Roberts and George B. Roberts Jr. of Philadelphia. His father, a retired Foreign Service officer, was the chief of the United States Mission in Laos from 1977 to 1979 and ambassador to Guyana from 1979 to 1981. He was later a visiting professor of politics at St. Joseph's University in Philadelphia.
The bridegroom's previous marriage ended in divorce, as did the bride's.
